byline.contributor: Mark Mazzetti reported from Washington, and David D. Kirkpatrick from Cairo. Saeed Al-Batati contributed reporting from Al Mukalla, Yemen, and Kareem Fahim from London.
byline.original: By MARK MAZZETTI and DAVID D. KIRKPATRICK

abstract: Saudi Arabia declares that it is among coalition of 10 nations that have launched a military operations and airstrikes in Yemen, aiming to stop advance of Shiite Houthi rebels who have overrun the government; says while Americans were not part of airstrikes, Saudis consulted with Obama administration before assault.
lead_paragraph: Saudi Arabia launched airstrikes with a coalition of 10 nations. The strikes came as Yemen was hurtling toward civil war after months of turmoil.

headline.main: Saudi Arabia Leads Air Assault in Yemen
headline.print_headline: Saudis Hit Yemen With Air Assault

snippet: Saudi Arabia launched airstrikes with a coalition of 10 nations. The strikes came as Yemen was hurtling toward civil war after months of turmoil.
